page.title: 14Farming in Dedham
page.content: This area has many mixed farms. Lower Barn Farm is typical. It is owned by Peter Moorhouse. He even has willow trees on his farm which are used as a crop for fencing and cricket bats. He has many fields near the river where his herd of 130 Friesian Cows graze. He also has 730 sheep which are crossed Border Leicester and Swaledale bred for fleece and sold for meat. He has some Suffolks for showing. The sheep graze on hilly fields which are more difficult to cultivate. They are dipped against diseases and sheared once a year. The crops he grows are sprayed to prevent weeds and fungi; and to help the crop to grow. He grows milling wheat, feed barley, silage grass, potatoes and sometimes beans for his animals.
